metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5195 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in mm/gup.c in the Linux kernel 2.x through 4.x before 4.8.3 allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging incorrect handling of a copy-on-write (COW) feature to write to a read-only memory mapping, as exploited in the wild in October 2016, aka "Dirty COW." It was discovered that a race condition existed in the memory manager of the Linux kernel when handling copy-on-write breakage of private read-only memory mappings. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-45-generic - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-4.4.0-45-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-4.4.0-45-lowlatency - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-4.4.0-45-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-4.4.0-45-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-4.4.0-45-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-4.4.0-45-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-45-generic - 4.4.0-45.66
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-45.66').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1029.36').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-45.66').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1032.36').
